item.name: Alarm Notification For : networkElementNotReachable
item.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) whenever a managed network element turns unreachable (ICMP).

item.name: Alarm Notification For : networkElementNotManageable
item.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) whenever a managed network element is reachable via ICMP but not reachable via the Management protocol (SNMP / TL1 )

item.name: Alarm Notification For : networkElementManageable
item.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) to clear the unreachable / not manageable events raised previously.

item.name: Alarm Notification For : unSupportedNetworkElementVersion
item.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) whenever it encounters / discovers a Network element running an Unsupported software version.

item.name: Alarm Notification For : cliLoginFailed
item.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) whenever it could not login to the CLI (or TL1) session of the Network Element using the supplied Credentials

item.name: Alarm Notification For : alarmEmailNotificationFailure
item.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) upon its Failure to send the E-Mail Notification to NB Clients registered for E-Mail Notification

item.name: Alarm Notification For : dataCollectionFailure
item.description: Indicates a Failure during Data Collection. NB managers can either ignore it (or) log-it.

item.name: Alarm Notification For : temsServerPerfMetricCriticalTCA
item.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) to report a Critical Threshold Crossing Alert, whenever the Critical Threshold limit is crossed for the current Performance Metric

item.name: Alarm Notification For : temsServerPerfMetricMajorTCA
item.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) to report a Major Threshold Crossing Alert, whenever the Major Threshold limit is crossed for the current Performance Metric

item.name: Alarm Notification For : temsServerPerfMetricMinorTCA
item.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) to report a Minor Threshold Crossing Alert, whenever the Minor Threshold limit is crossed for the current Performance Metric

item.name: Alarm Notification For : temsServerPerfMetricClearTCA
item.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) to Clear the previously raised Critical / Major / Minor TCA for this Performance Metric.

item.name: Alarm Notification For : alarmFromNetworkElement
item.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) to report an Alarm Raised due to the occurence of a trap from the Network Element. Severity List includes Cleared. the Clear Alarm should clear the previous raise Alarm. The combination of networkElementIPAddress, sourceComponent (if any), alarmCategory (if available) and alarmSeverity shall be used to uniquely identify a specific root cause

item.name: Alarm Notification For : hotStandbyTakesOver
item.description: Indicates a Switchover of the Management server from primary to Standby Server. Note:This alarm will be triggered only when the Management Server is deployed in a Primary - HotStandBy mode.

item.name: Alarm Notification For : primaryServerisRestored
item.description: Indicates that the Primary Management Server has been restored back in Service. Note:This alarm will be triggered only when the Management Server is deployed in a Primary - HotStandBy mode.

item.name: Alarm Notification For : alarmfromElementManagementSystem
item.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) to report an Alarm Raised due to the occurence of a trap from the Network Management System. Severity List includes Cleared. the Clear Alarm should clear the previous raise Alarm. The combination of networkElementIPAddress, sourceComponent (if any), alarmCategory (if available) and alarmSeverity shall be used to uniquely identify a specific root cause

item.name: Alarm Notification For : georedundancyGroupMismatch
item.description: Management server will send this notification to its NB clients (NMS / OSS) when it detects mismatch information from EMS, active and standby network element

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.1$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.1")}=1 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.1$\b)"].nodata(3d)}=0
trigger.name: Managed network element turns unreachable (ICMP).
trigger.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) whenever a managed network element turns unreachable (ICMP).

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.2$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.2")}=1 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.2$\b)"].nodata(3d)}=0 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.3$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.3")}=0
trigger.name: Managed network element is reachable via ICMP but not reachable via the Management protocol (SNMP / TL1 )
trigger.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) whenever a managed network element is reachable via ICMP but not reachable via the Management protocol (SNMP / TL1 )

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.3$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.3")}=1 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.3$\b)"].nodata(1d)}=0
trigger.name: NB Clients (NMS / OSS) to clear the unreachable / not manageable events raised previously.
trigger.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) to clear the unreachable / not manageable events raised previously.

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.4$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.4")}=1 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.4$\b)"].nodata(3d)}=0
trigger.name: Encounters / discovers a Network element running an Unsupported software version.
trigger.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) whenever it encounters / discovers a Network element running an Unsupported software version.

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.5$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.5")}=1 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.5$\b)"].nodata(3d)}=0
trigger.name: Could not login to the CLI (or TL1) session of the Network Element using the supplied Credentials
trigger.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) whenever it could not login to the CLI (or TL1) session of the Network Element using the supplied Credentials

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.6$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.6")}=1 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.6$\b)"].nodata(3d)}=0
trigger.name: Failure to send the E-Mail Notification to NB Clients registered for E-Mail Notification
trigger.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) upon its Failure to send the E-Mail Notification to NB Clients registered for E-Mail Notification

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.7$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.7")}=1 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.7$\b)"].nodata(3d)}=0
trigger.name: Failure during Data Collection. NB managers can either ignore it (or) log-it.
trigger.description: Indicates a Failure during Data Collection. NB managers can either ignore it (or) log-it.

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.8$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.8")}=1 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.8$\b)"].nodata(3d)}=0 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.11$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.11")}=0
trigger.name: Critical Threshold Crossing Alert.
trigger.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) to report a Critical Threshold Crossing Alert, whenever the Critical Threshold limit is crossed for the current Performance Metric

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.9$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.9")}=1 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.9$\b)"].nodata(3d)}=0 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.11$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.11")}=0
trigger.name: Major Threshold Crossing Alert
trigger.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) to report a Major Threshold Crossing Alert, whenever the Major Threshold limit is crossed for the current Performance Metric

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.10$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.10")}=1 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.10$\b)"].nodata(3d)}=0 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.11$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.11")}=0
trigger.name: Minor Threshold Crossing Alert
trigger.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) to report a Minor Threshold Crossing Alert, whenever the Minor Threshold limit is crossed for the current Performance Metric

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.11$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.11")}=1 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.11$\b)"].nodata(1d)}=0
trigger.name: Clear previously raised Critical / Major / Minor TCA for this Performance Metric.
trigger.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) to Clear the previously raised Critical / Major / Minor TCA for this Performance Metric.

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.12$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.12")}=1 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.12$\b)"].nodata(3d)}=0
trigger.name: Alarm Raised due to the occurence of a trap from the Network Element.
trigger.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) to report an Alarm Raised due to the occurence of a trap from the Network Element. Severity List includes Cleared. the Clear Alarm should clear the previous raise Alarm. The combination of networkElementIPAddress, sourceComponent (if any), alarmCategory (if available) and alarmSeverity shall be used to uniquely identify a specific root cause

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.13$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.13")}=1 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.13$\b)"].nodata(3d)}=0 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.14$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.14")}=0
trigger.name: Indicates a Switchover of the Management server from primary to Standby Server.
trigger.description: Indicates a Switchover of the Management server from primary to Standby Server. Note:This alarm will be triggered only when the Management Server is deployed in a Primary - HotStandBy mode.

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.14$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.14")}=1 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.14$\b)"].nodata(1d)}=0
trigger.name: Indicates that the Primary Management Server has been restored back in Service.
trigger.description: Indicates that the Primary Management Server has been restored back in Service. Note:This alarm will be triggered only when the Management Server is deployed in a Primary - HotStandBy mode.

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.15$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.15")}=1 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.15$\b)"].nodata(3d)}=0
trigger.name: Alarm Raised due to the occurence of a trap from the Network Management System.
trigger.description: Management Server will send this notification to its NB Clients (NMS / OSS) to report an Alarm Raised due to the occurence of a trap from the Network Management System. Severity List includes Cleared. the Clear Alarm should clear the previous raise Alarm. The combination of networkElementIPAddress, sourceComponent (if any), alarmCategory (if available) and alarmSeverity shall be used to uniquely identify a specific root cause

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.16$\b)"].str("enterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.16")}=1 & {Template SNMP Traps AFFIRMED Nodes:snmptrap["(\benterprises.37963.6.3.1.3.16$\b)"].nodata(3d)}=0
trigger.name: Mismatch information from EMS, active and standby network element
trigger.description: Management server will send this notification to its NB clients (NMS / OSS) when it detects mismatch information from EMS, active and standby network element
